comfirm.title: Online Inquiry
comfirm.subTitle: Do You Have Questions About Studying in Korea?
comfirm.description:
If you have any questions about studying in Korea, feel free to contact REC’s Academy.

You may ask about majors, university selection, costs, admission requirements, visas, or any other study-abroad-related concerns.

Our experienced study-abroad consultants will review your inquiry and respond within 24 hours.

formFields.label: Contactable messenger ID or phone number

options.label: I would like to receive a university and major recommendation
I would like to understand the admission requirements

formFields.label: Inquiry Details
formFields.description: Please describe your academic background, interests, or questions in detail.

formFields.label: I agree to the collection and use of my personal information.

comfirm.footerText: REC’s Academy helps students determine the most appropriate visa pathway based on their goals.

guide.title: Guide
guide.description:
REC’s Academy provides a practical settlement guide to help international students preparing to study in Korea,

or those who have just arrived, quickly access essential information for daily life and smooth academic adjustment.

links.title:
Is it possible to enter

a Korean university without TOPIK?
links.description:
Studying in Korea without TOPIK is possible,

depending on your university and major.

links.title:
Studying in Korea

Where should I start?
links.description:
A step-by-step guide for international students starting

their study-abroad journey in Korea.

section1.text1:
If you are considering studying abroad in Korea,

one of the most common questions you will encounter is:

Is TOPIK (Test of Proficiency in Korean) really necessary?
section1.text2:
For students who are new to the Korean language,

high TOPIK score requirements can feel daunting.
section1.text3:
However, with the expansion of English-taught programs, conditional admissions,

and language linked pathways,

it is increasingly possible to study in Korea without TOPIK,

depending on your chosen university and major.
section1.text4: In this guide, REC’s Academy explains:

questions:
Are There Universities

You Can Enter Without TOPIK?

Things to Consider

When Choosing a university

eligibility.q: Are There Universities You Can Enter Without TOPIK?
eligibility.title: Many Korean universities operate admission processes for international students that <semibold>do not require TOPIK at the time of application,</semibold> or that evaluate applicants based on alternative criteria.

display.title: TOPIK may not be required for:
list: Programs where admissions focus more on:

eligibility.footerText:
In such cases, TOPIK is not a prerequisite for admission.

REC’s Academy helps students identify universities and majors where TOPIK is not initially required

and where admission pathways are realistic.

english.q: Admission process based on English proficiency
english.title:
Many Korean universities offer English-taught degree programs

and accept internationally recognized English test scores, such as:
english.footerText: In some cases, students from <semibold>English-speaking countries</semibold> may be exempt from English proficiency requirements. REC’s Academy evaluates each student’s English level and matches them with suitable English-based programs.

conditional.title: If you do not have TOPIK but wish to enroll in a Korean-taught degree program, you may apply through:

items.title: Admission is granted on the condition that the student achieves a required Korean level within a specified period.
Students first enroll in a <semibold>university-affiliated Korean language institute.</semibold>
After reaching the required level, they transition into a degree program.
Entry to Korea on a <semibold>D-4 (language) visa</semibold>

conditional.footerText: REC’s Academy explains these options clearly and helps students plan <semibold>realistic timelines.</semibold>

topik.q: Are There TOPIK Requirements After Admission?
topik.title:
Even if TOPIK is not required for admission, some universities require TOPIK for graduation.

Common graduation-related requirements include:
list: Submission of a TOPIK score (often <semibold>Level 4 or higher</semibold>)
Completion of mandatory Korean language courses

footerDisplay.title: Important
footerDisplay.description:
Always check graduation requirements, not just admission conditions.

REC’s Academy reviews both admission and graduation language requirements before students apply.

considerations.q: Things to Consider When Choosing a university
considerations.title: If you plan to apply without TOPIK, carefully check:
list: Does the university operate a <semibold>language institute</semibold>?
Are language requirements clearly stated in official guidelines?

footerDisplay.title: Note
footerDisplay.description: Language requirements may vary by major. Programs in <semibold>arts, design, and physical education</semibold> often have more flexible standards than theory-heavy majors.

section3.title: Conclusion
section3.description: Studying in Korea <semibold>without TOPIK is possible,</semibold> but it requires <semibold>strategic planning.</semibold>

list.title:
Students can successfully enter Korean universities even without prior Korean language certification.

REC’s Academy supports students by:
items: Providing structured, compliant, and transparent guidance

section3.description2:
There are many ways to open the door to studying in Korea.

The most important step is choosing the path that fits you best.

display.title: Contact REC’s Academy
display.description: For personalized guidance on studying at a Korean university

section1.text1:
If you are considering studying abroad in Korea, you may wonder where to begin.

Admission requirements, language preparation, visas,

and university selection can feel overwhelming at first.
section1.text2:
This guide provides a step-by-step starting point

for international students, especially from Africa and Central Asia,

who are beginning their study-abroad planning.

questions:
Visa Types:

Which Visa Do You Need?

visa.title: Visa Types: Which Visa Do You Need?
visa.description: The first step is identifying your <semibold>study goal,</semibold> as your visa depends on it.
visa.footerText: REC’s Academy helps students determine the most appropriate visa pathway based on their goals.

language.title: Language Requirements: Korean vs. English
language.description: Korean universities usually require proof of language proficiency.

list.title: Korean (TOPIK)
list.subTitle: Typical requirements:
list.displayText: Some majors have more flexible standards, and some universities require TOPIK for graduation even if it was not required for admission.

list.title: English Proficiency
list.subTitle: For English-taught programs:
list.displayText: REC’s Academy helps students identify whether Korean or English pathways are more realistic.

university.title: How should I choose a university?
university.footerText: If your TOPIK level is not sufficient, English-taught or language-linked pathways may be more suitable.

preparation.title: Recommended Preparation Order
preparation.footerText: This process typically takes <semibold>3-6 months or longer,</semibold> depending on circumstances.

section3.title: Final note
section3.description:
Studying in Korea is not just an application, it is a life transition into a new academic and cultural environment.

Start step by step, based on what you can prepare now.

ourDifference.description:
Studying abroad on Earth begins with a different approach, not the same information.

We design real possibilities tailored to each student's unique circumstances.

items.title: Real-time 1:1 response consulting
items.description: From consultations to schedule management and issues that arise, A dedicated manager will respond in real time.

items.title: Study abroad design based on individual conditions
items.description: We offer personalized study abroad programs tailored to your needs, including budget, age, and nationality.

realPossibilities.title: Personalized
realPossibilities.description:
With personalized support tailored to each individual,

studying in Korea becomes a realistic goal for everyone when preparation is done right.

ourPartnerColleges.title: Wich College is right for me?
ourPartnerColleges.description: Carefully selected colleges that match your goals, budget, and future plans.

introducation.title: Introducation
introducation.description: To ensure that your journey in a foreign land is not lonely, Earth Study Abroad will accompany you on your study abroad journey

section1.title:
Your Structured

Pathway to Korea
section1.description1:
REC’s Academy was founded to be more than a study-abroad center.

We exist to serve as a trusted bridge for students from Africa and Central Asia who aspire to study

at Korean universities.

Studying in Korea is not simply an academic choice—it is the beginning of a new life in

an unfamiliar language, culture, and education system.

On this journey, the quality of guidance and support truly matters

REC’s Academy provides structured, end-to-end support, from university selection and document preparation to visa guidance and arrival orientation.
section1.description2:
Our focus is on practical preparation, compliance, and long-term student stability, not quick placements or empty promises.

While we continue to expand partnerships with Korean universities, our greatest measure of success

remains unchanged: seeing our students adapt successfully, progress academically, and build a

sustainable future in Korea.
section1.description3: We remain committed to supporting every student’s journey with responsibility, sincerity, and real outcomes

section2.title: One-Stop Support from Admission to Settlement
section2.description: REC’s Academy supports you throughout the entire study-abroad journey—from start to finish.

items.title:
End-to-End University

Admissions Assistance
items.description: We provide systematic support for the full admissions process, including:
list: Writing and editing personal statements and study plans

items.title:
Visa Application

Guidance
items.description: We offer accurate and countryspecific guidance on:
list: Compliance with immigration regulations Visa issuance remains under the authority of the relevant immigration offices, but we ensure you are wellprepared.

items.title:
Arrival & Settlement

Support
items.description: To help students transition smoothly into life in Korea, we assist with:

section2.footerText: With REC’s Academy, students receive<highlight>structured</highlight><highlight>reliable</highlight>and<highlight>continuous support</highlight>— all in one place.

procedures.title: Procedures
procedures.description:
REC’s Academy provides structured support across six key stages, guiding students from

the start of their study-abroad journey through admission and settlement in Korea.

hero.title: Studying in Korea: How It Works
hero.description:
Studying in Korea follows six structured steps, guiding students

from initial consultation through university admission, visa preparation, and settlement support.

grid.title: Pre-Consultation
grid.description: We collect essential information such as:
list: Intended major or field of study
grid.footerText: This stage helps define a realistic and strategic study-abroad direction.

grid.title: University & Program Selection
grid.description:
REC’s Academy compares and recommends suitable

Korean universities and majors based on each student’s

academic profile, goals, and eligibility.

grid.title: Document Preparation
grid.description: We support the preparation and review of required application documents, including:

grid.title: University Application
grid.description: Applications and documents are submitted within official deadlines, and we assist students throughout the university selection process.

grid.title:
Admission Result &

Visa Guidance
list: Students receive their official admission letter
REC’s Academy provides guidance on required visa documents and application procedures (Visa issuance is governed by Korean immigration authorities.)

grid.title:
Departure &

Settlement Support
list: Initial settlement and orientation after arrival in Korea

procedures.footerText: This structured process ensures a<highlight>smooth and confident transition</highlight>into university life in Korea.

program.title: Program
program.description:
REC’s Academy offers structured language preparation, degree admission support, short-term study experiences,

and customized study-abroad pathways for international students aspiring to study in Korea.

banner.title: Intensive Korean Language Study Program
list: REC’s Academy coordinates Korean language training in collaboration with <bold>university-affiliated language schools</bold> at national and private Korean universities.
Students develop core language skills, including <bold>speaking, listening, reading, and writing</bold> through structured, accredited programs.

list.value: 4 times per year (March, June, September, December)
Conditional admission to selected universities may be possible
Guidance for dormitories or approved external accommodation

items.title: Recommended For
list: Prospective international students preparing for Korean university entry
Learners seeking to improve Korean language proficiency

banner.title: Korean University Degree Admission Support
list:
REC’s Academy provides professional consulting and document support for international students applying

to Bachelor’s and Master’s degree programs at Korean universities.
We offer step-by-step guidance to help students meet academic, language, and institutional admission requirements.

items.title: Key Features
list: Guidance for admission to Korean universities (undergraduate & graduate levels)
Support for applicants planning a <bold>major change or long-term career development in Korea</bold>

items.title: Our Support Includes
list: Analysis of admission requirements (TOPIK, English proficiency, GPA, etc.)
Writing and editing of personal statements and study plans
Coordination of application submission and preparation for the selection process

banner.title: An intensive program that allows you to experience Korea for a short period of time
list:
We offer short-term training programs that allow you to experience the Korean language,

culture, and university life for a short period of 3 to 8 weeks.
banner.buttonText: Apply for short-term study abroad counseling

items.title: Key Features
list: Foreign students who want to experience Korea during their vacation
Prospective international students who want to experience the Korean university environment before enrolling

items.title: Recommended For
list: Korean language classes + cultural experiences (hanbok, traditional food, company tours, etc.)
Accommodation provided on or connected to the university campus
Issuance of the certificate of completion and provision of confirmation of participation
